title: Paul Hogan on Donald Trump, travelling and turning 80
text:
Fiona Carruthers Sophisticated Traveller Editor Oct 8, 2019 — 10.13am Share

Any upcoming projects for 2020?

I’ve got a movie slated to come out in January on Australia Day, The Very Excellent Mr Dundee, directed by Dean Murphy. I didn’t choose the title; I wanted it to be called No Good Deed Goes Unpunished, because the film is basically me getting into trouble from start to finish.

Did it make you sentimental for Australia?

I'm always sentimental for Australia. I love Australia and wish I could move back to Sydney – it's where I'm from; it's my tribe. But I'm a single dad over here in LA with a 20-year-old son [Chance Hogan with ex-wife Linda Kozlowski] who's in a band, and he's not quite ready to be left yet. He is 20, but kids don't tend to mature as fast these days as we used to. Seems you're not really grown up nowadays till 30.

Where would you move – back to your roots?

Cut it out! I was from Chullora in Sydney's western suburbs. As soon as I got some money, I moved my young family to Mosman [on the city's posh lower north shore]. When I'm home these days, I love staying with my daughter – she's on the northern beaches. We go out for beaut family Japanese dinners at Momokko in Belrose. It's run by a terrific bloke called Charlie.

These days, Hogan lives right on the boardwalk of LA's Venice Beach. Shutterstock

At least you're living on Venice Beach in Los Angeles …

You mean "the ghetto by the shore" – that's what the locals call Venice. Being near a beach feels a bit like home. I live right on the boardwalk; it's great for watching all the lunatics of LA strolling past.

So where's hot with Hollywood types right now?

I don't hang out with many celebrities – a bit with [actor and filmmaker] Gary Oldman, but that's pretty much it. I used to hang out with Chris Hemsworth, but he's moved back home to Byron Bay. My favourite local is The Firehouse, inside an old fire station downtown.

I only fly in first class if someone else is paying; if I’m paying, it’s business class. — Paul Hogan

Will Trump be impeached? And if not, will he win the 2020 presidential election?

My hunch is he won't be impeached – but if he is, I will really miss him. He's a galah, but he's the most entertaining politician since [Roman emperor] Caligula. If he makes it through to the end of 2020, I have a sneaky suspicion he'll win in November next year. The Democrats don't have any charismatic, malleable opponents. Unless they can convince Oprah or Ellen [DeGeneres] to run, I'd say they're stuffed.

All-time favourite holiday destination?

Italy, end of story. I adore Italy and I've been there many times: Rome, Venice, the Amalfi Coast – I love all of it. In Rome, I stay at Hotel Hassler, at the top of the Spanish Steps. The Belmond Hotel Caruso in Ravello is a superb spot that overlooks the Amalfi. A few years ago, I met [actor] Michael Caine when I was staying at the Belmond Splendido Mare in Portofino.
description: Hoges has been selling Australia since he first slipped “a shrimp on the barbie” in 1984, but the 80-year-old calls Los Angeles home – for now.
